nodes.name: Records by date

parameters.name: records_by_date_and_or_status

workflowId.cachedResultName: Template | Your first AI Data Analyst

parameters.description: Use this tool to get records filtered by date. You can also filter by status at the same time, if you want.

value.status: ={{ $fromAI("status", "Status of the transaction. Can be Completed, Refund or Error. Leave empty if you don't need this now.", "string") }}

nodes.name: Aggregate
nodes.notes: This aggregate node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
To send all the items back to the AI, we need to finish with everything aggregated into one single item.

Otherwise it will respond with one item at a time, and the AI will only get the first item that arrives.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
This node sends a custom HTTP Request to the Google Sheets API.

Filtering by date range in the Google Sheets API is very complicated.

This node solves that problem.

But doing the same in a database is much simpler. A tool could do it without needing a sub-workflow.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
The output from this complex request is also messy.

So we use some code generated by ChatGPT to transform the data into JSON objects.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Google Sheets request

parameters.name: tq
parameters.value: =SELECT * WHERE A >= DATE "{{ $json.start_date }}" AND A <= DATE "{{ $json.end_date }}"

nodes.notes: This httpRequest node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Get transactions by product name

parameters.toolDescription:
Find transactions by product.
Our products are:
- Widget A
- Widget B
- Widget C
- Widget D

nodes.notes: This googleSheetsTool node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Get all transactions

parameters.toolDescription: Only use this as last resort, because it will pull all data at once.

nodes.notes: This googleSheetsTool node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content:
## Some questions to try
There's a red button on this page that you can click to chat with the AI.

Try asking it these questions:

- How many refunds in January and what was the amount refunded?

- How many successful sales did we have in January 2025 and what was the final income of those?

- What is the most frequent reason for refunds?

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note11

parameters.content:
## ðŸ‘ˆ This is a special tool
It is used to call another workflow.
This concept is called sub-workflow.

See documentation [here]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

Instead of running a completely separate workflow, we are calling the one below.

It's contained in the same workflow, but we are using the trigger to define it will run only when called by this tool.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note12

parameters.content:
# Sub-workflow
The AI can call this sub-workflow anytime,
by using the **Records by date** tool.

The sub-workflow automatically return
 the result of the last executed node to the AI.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Chattrigger Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Chattrigger Workflow. This workflow integrates 14 different services: stickyNote, httpRequest, filter, code, agent. It contains 36 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 36
- **Node Types**: 14
- **Error Handling**: âœ… Implemented
- **Security**: âœ… Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: âœ… Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **When chat message received**: chatTrigger
- **AI Agent**: agent
- **OpenAI Chat Model**: lmChatOpenAi
- **Calculator**: toolCalculator
- **Code**: code
- **When Executed by Another Workflow**: executeWorkflowTrigger
- **Records by date**: toolWorkflow
- **Aggregate**: aggregate
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- ... and 26 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
